001/*

006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.LineSegment;
011import renderer.framebuffer.*;
012import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
013
014import java.awt.Color;
015
016/**
017   Rasterize a clipped {@link LineSegment} into shaded pixels
018   in a {@link FrameBuffer}'s viewport and (optionally)
019   gamma-encode the line at the same time.
020<p>
021   This pipeline stage takes a clipped {@link LineSegment}
022   with vertices in the {@link Camera}'s view rectangle and
023   rasterizezs the line segment into shaded pixels in a
024   {@link FrameBuffer}'s viewport. This rasterizer will
025   linearly interpolate color from the line segment's two
026   endpoints to each rasterized pixel in the line segment.
027<p>
028   This rasterization algorithm is based on
029<pre>
030     "Fundamentals of Computer Graphics", 3rd Edition,
031      by Peter Shirley, pages 163-165.
032</pre>
033*/
034public class Rasterize_Line
035{
036   /**
037      Rasterize a clipped {@link LineSegment} into shaded pixels
038      in the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}.
039
040      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link LineSegment} {@code ls} comes from
041      @param ls     {@link LineSegment} to rasterize into the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
042      @param vp     {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} to hold rasterized pixels
043   */
044   public static void rasterize(final Model model,
045                                final LineSegment ls,
046                                final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
047   {
048      // Make local copies of several values.
049      final int w = vp.getWidthVP();
050      final int h = vp.getHeightVP();
051
052      final int vIndex0 = ls.vIndexList.get(0);
053      final int vIndex1 = ls.vIndexList.get(1);
054      final Vertex v0 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex0);
055      final Vertex v1 = model.vertexList.get(vIndex1);
056
057      final int cIndex0 = ls.cIndexList.get(0);
058      final int cIndex1 = ls.cIndexList.get(1);
059      final float[] c0 = model.colorList.get(cIndex0).getRGBComponents(null);
060      final float[] c1 = model.colorList.get(cIndex1).getRGBComponents(null);
061      float r0 = c0[0], g0 = c0[1], b0 = c0[2];
062      float r1 = c1[0], g1 = c1[1], b1 = c1[2];
063
064      // Transform each vertex to the "pixel plane" coordinate system.
065      double x0 = 0.5 + w/2.001 * (v0.x + 1); // x_pp = 0.5 + w/2 * (x_p+1)
066      double y0 = 0.5 + h/2.001 * (v0.y + 1); // y_pp = 0.5 + h/2 * (y_p+1)
067      double x1 = 0.5 + w/2.001 * (v1.x + 1);
068      double y1 = 0.5 + h/2.001 * (v1.y + 1);
069      // NOTE: Notice the 2.001 fudge factor in the last two equations.
070      // This is explained on page 142 of
071      //    "Jim Blinn's Corner: A Trip Down The Graphics Pipeline"
072      //     by Jim Blinn, 1996, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers.
073
074      if (Rasterize.debug)
075      {
076         logMessage(String.format("(x0_pp, y0_pp) = (%9.4f, %9.4f)", x0,y0));
077         logMessage(String.format("(x1_pp, y1_pp) = (%9.4f, %9.4f)", x1,y1));
078      }
079
080      // Round each vertex to the nearest logical pixel.
081      // This makes the algorithm a lot simpler, but it can
082      // cause a slight, but noticeable, shift of the line segment.
083      x0 = Math.round(x0);
084      y0 = Math.round(y0);
085      x1 = Math.round(x1);
086      y1 = Math.round(y1);
087
088      // Get the z coordinates.
089      double z0 = v0.z;
090      double z1 = v1.z;
091
092      // Rasterize a degenerate line segment (a line segment
093      // that projected onto a point) as a single pixel.
094      if ( (x0 == x1) && (y0 == y1) )
095      {
096         final int x0_vp = (int)x0 - 1;  // viewport coordinate
097         final int y0_vp = h - (int)y0;  // viewport coordinate
098
099         // Get the z-buffer value currently at this pixel of the viewport.
100         double zBuff = vp.getDepthVP(x0_vp, y0_vp);
101
102         // Determine which endpoint of the line segment is in front
103         // and use the z value and color values from that endpoint.
104         final double z;
105         final float r;
106         final float g;
107         final float b;
108         if ( z0 >= z1 )
109         {
110            z = z0;
111            r = r0;
112            g = g0;
113            b = b0;
114         }
115         else
116         {
117            z = z1;
118            r = r1;
119            g = g1;
120            b = b1;
121         }
122
123         // Determine if the front endpoint is in front of what is in
124         // the framebuffer. If so, overwrite the data in the framebuffer.
125         if ( z > zBuff )
126         {
127            if (Rasterize.debug) logPixel(x0, y0, x0_vp, y0_vp, r, g, b, vp);
128            // Log the pixel before setting it so that an array out-
129            // of-bounds error will be right after the pixel's address.
130
131            vp.setPixelVP(x0_vp, y0_vp, new Color(r, g, b));
132            vp.setDepthVP(x0_vp, y0_vp, z);
133         }
134         return;
135      }
136
137      // If abs(slope) > 1, then transpose this line so that
138      // the transposed line has slope < 1. Remember that the
139      // line has been transposed.
140      final boolean transposedLine;
141      if (Math.abs(y1 - y0) > Math.abs(x1 - x0)) // if abs(slope) > 1
142      {
143         // Swap x0 with y0.
144         final double temp0 = x0;
145         x0 = y0;
146         y0 = temp0;
147         // Swap x1 with y1.
148         final double temp1 = x1;
149         x1 = y1;
150         y1 = temp1;
151         transposedLine = true; // Remember that this line is transposed.
152      }
153      else
154      {
155         transposedLine = false; // Remember that this line is not transposed.
156      }
157
158      if (x1 < x0) // We want to rasterize in the direction of increasing x,
159      {            // so, if necessary, swap (x0, y0, z0) with (x1, y1, z1).
160         // Swap x0 with x1.
161         final double tempX = x0;
162         x0 = x1;
163         x1 = tempX;
164         // Swap y0 with y1.
165         final double tempY = y0;
166         y0 = y1;
167         y1 = tempY;
168         // Swap z0 with z1.
169         final double tempZ = z0;
170         z0 = z1;
171         z1 = tempZ;
172         // Swap the colors too.
173         final float tempR = r0;
174         final float tempG = g0;
175         final float tempB = b0;
176         r0 = r1;
177         g0 = g1;
178         b0 = b1;
179         r1 = tempR;
180         g1 = tempG;
181         b1 = tempB;
182      }
183
184      // Compute this line segment's slopes.
185      final double      m = (y1 - y0) / (x1 - x0);
186      final double slopeZ = (z1 - z0) / (x1 - x0);
187      final double slopeR = (r1 - r0) / (x1 - x0);
188      final double slopeG = (g1 - g0) / (x1 - x0);
189      final double slopeB = (b1 - b0) / (x1 - x0);
190
191      if (Rasterize.debug)
192      {
193         final String inverseSlope = (transposedLine)
194                                        ? " (transposed, so 1/m = " + 1/m + ")"
195                                        : "";
196         logMessage("Slope m    = " + m + inverseSlope);
197         logMessage("Slope z    = " + slopeZ);
198         logMessage("Slope mRed = " + slopeR);
199         logMessage("Slope mGrn = " + slopeG);
200         logMessage("Slope mBlu = " + slopeB);
201         logMessage(String.format("(x0_vp, y0_vp, z0) = (%9.4f, %9.4f, %9.4f)", x0-1,h-y0,z0));
202         logMessage(String.format("(x1_vp, y1_vp, z1) = (%9.4f, %9.4f, %9.4f)", x1-1,h-y1,z1));
203      }
204
205      // Rasterize this line segment in the direction of increasing x.
206      // In the following loop, as x moves across the logical horizontal
207      // (or vertical) pixels, we will compute a y value for each x.
208      double y = y0;
209      for (int x = (int)x0; x < (int)x1; x += 1, y += m)
210      {
211         // Compute the viewport coordinates of this pixel.
212         // The value of y will almost always be between
213         // two vertical (or horizontal) pixel coordinates.
214         // By rounding off the value of y, we are choosing the
215         // nearest logical vertical (or horizontal) pixel coordinate.
216         final int x_vp;  // viewport coordinate
217         final int y_vp;  // viewport coordinate
218         if ( ! transposedLine )
219         {
220            x_vp = x - 1;
221            y_vp = h - (int)Math.round(y);
222         }
223         else // a transposed line
224         {
225            x_vp = (int)Math.round(y) - 1;
226            y_vp = h - x;
227         }
228
229         // Interpolate this pixel's depth between the two endpoint's depths.
230         final double z = z0 + slopeZ * (x - x0);
231
232         // Get the z-buffer value currently at this pixel of the viewport.
233         final double zBuff = vp.getDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp);
234
235         // If the current fragment is in front of what is in the
236         //  framebuffer, then overwrite the data in the framebuffer.
237         if (z > zBuff)
238         {
239            // Interpolate this pixel's color between the two endpoint's colors.
240            float r = (float)Math.abs(r0 + slopeR*(x - x0));
241            float g = (float)Math.abs(g0 + slopeG*(x - x0));
242            float b = (float)Math.abs(b0 + slopeB*(x - x0));
243            // We need the Math.abs() because otherwise, we sometimes get -0.0.
244
245            if (Rasterize.doGamma)
246            {
247               // Apply gamma-encoding (gamma-compression) to the colors.
248               // https://www.scratchapixel.com/lessons/digital-imaging/digital-images
249               // http://blog.johnnovak.net/2016/09/21/what-every-coder-should-know-about-gamma/
250               final double gammaInv = 1.0 / Rasterize.GAMMA;
251               r = (float)Math.pow(r, gammaInv);
252               g = (float)Math.pow(g, gammaInv);
253               b = (float)Math.pow(b, gammaInv);
254            }
255
256            if (Rasterize.debug)
257            {
258               if ( ! transposedLine )
259               {
260                  logPixel(x, y, x_vp, y_vp, r, g, b, vp);
261               }
262               else // a transposed line
263               {
264                  logPixel(y, x, x_vp, y_vp, r, g, b, vp);
265               }
266            }
267            // Log the pixel before setting it so that an array out-
268            // of-bounds error will be right after the pixel's address.
269
270            vp.setPixelVP(x_vp, y_vp, new Color(r, g, b));
271            vp.setDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp, z);
272         }
273         // Advance (x,y) to the next pixel (delta_x is 1, so delta_y is m).
274      }
275      // Set the pixel for the (x1,y1,z1) endpoint.
276      // We do this separately to avoid rounding errors.
277      final int x_vp;  // viewport coordinate
278      final int y_vp;  // viewport coordinate
279      if ( ! transposedLine )
280      {
281         x_vp = (int)x1 - 1;
282         y_vp = h - (int)y1;
283      }
284      else // a transposed line
285      {
286         x_vp = (int)y1 - 1;
287         y_vp = h - (int)x1;
288      }
289      final double zBuff = vp.getDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp);
290      if (z1 > zBuff)
291      {
292         if (Rasterize.debug)
293         {
294            if ( ! transposedLine )
295            {
296               logPixel(x1, y1, x_vp, y_vp, r1, g1, b1, vp);
297            }
298            else // a transposed line
299            {
300               logPixel(y1, x1, x_vp, y_vp, r1, g1, b1, vp);
301            }
302         }
303         vp.setPixelVP(x_vp, y_vp, new Color(r1, g1, b1));
304         vp.setDepthVP(x_vp, y_vp, z1);
305      }
306   }
307
308
309
310   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
311   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
312   private Rasterize_Line() {
313      throw new AssertionError();
314   }
315}
